intro: Lobelia sebae, commonly known as the sacred lotus of Hawaii, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Lobelia sebae is also known for its cultural significance to Native Hawaiian traditions.
